refund.title: Refund Request
refund.messageRefund: A cancellation request can be made at any time. However, to have a refund, the request must be made 48 hours before the date of the stay.
refund.messageImportant: Unfortunately, your stay is expected in less than 48 hours. this means that the cancellation will not be refunded according to the waterlife boat reservation rules.

successRefund.title: Cancellation confirmed
successRefund.message1: The cancellation of your stay was successful.
successRefund.message2: If you were eligible for a refund, you should receive your payment within the next few days.
successRefund.message3: Thank you for placing your trust in Waterlife Boats and looking forward to seeing you in one of our facilities.

contract.title: General rules for all types of rentals
contract.condition: Owners are responsible for ensuring that their rental properties and boats are in good repair, clean and safe.
contract.access: Access to rental properties and boats must be possible and safe with a 2-wheel drive vehicle unless it states otherwise in the advertisement.
contract.dog: If owners have pets, they must not in any way disrupt the arrival and departure of customers from the rental site identified in the online booking or negatively affect their rental experience.
contract.embarcations: Owners must provide the number of life jackets corresponding to the number of places in the boat or floating home rented.
contract.deposit: Owners have up to 14 days after the end of a rental to decide whether to keep the security deposit for breakage or damage caused by a rental.
contract.ban: The WaterLife Boats management team may withdraw listings associated with a single major complaint or repeated minor complaints.
contract.breakage: WaterLife Boats is not responsible for theft or damage caused in the context of rentals through its website.
contract.gaz: Rental of boats powered exclusively by gasoline engine (s) is not permitted through the WaterLife Boats website.
contract.charge: The batteries contained in boats powered by an electric motor must be fully charged at the start of the rental.
contract.doc: A written document must be provided to the boat renter on site to clearly explain how to safely operate the electric motor including the maximum duration and distance of autonomy before having to recharge the batteries.
contract.material: Owners listing rentals on the WaterLife Boats website must provide all water safety equipment required for the type of boat being rented. For detailed information on this subject, owners can refer to the website of Transport Canada's Office of Boating Safety at https://tc.canada.ca/en/marine-transportation/marine-safety/office-boating-safety

becomeHost.institutionmin: Institution number must be composed of 3 numbers.
becomeHost.transitmin: Transit number must be composed of 5 numbers.

becomeHost.title: Setup your payment method

About.firsttext: 3% of the amount of each rental on bateauxwaterlife.ca is directed towards the protection of water bodies.
About.secondtext1: Some trees, such as the hybrid poplar, can extract very large amounts of contaminants from agricultural land. Planting trees alongside streams and rivers on agricultural land can thus protect nearby waterways.
About.secondtext2: The Carbone riverainTM program of the Arbre-Évolution cooperative finances the conversion of plots of agricultural land located along streams and rivers into vegetated areas.
About.secondtext3: Since November 2021, WaterLife Boats has funded the revegetation of 200 m2 of riparian agricultural land, which includes tree planting and long-term maintenance.
About.thirdtitle: Technological innovation to help restore freshwater health
About.thirdtext: WaterLife Boats is proud to support Aqua-Action, a registered non-profit organization whose mission is to restore freshwater health in North America.

OwnerRefund.title: Cancellation Request
OwnerRefund.messageRefund: A cancellation request can be made at any time. A full refund will be made to the tenant in the event of cancellation.
